page.title: 09LEISURE IN SANDWICK
page.content: Sandwick is well provided with leisure facilities. The community school built in 1984 is used partic- ularly during the winter months. Badminton, netball, indoor cricket, football training, the Boys Brigade and the Guides and Brownies meet there. Evening classes are organised from October to March in various subjects- typing, computing, golf, photography, pottery, Norwegian, sewing and woodwork. The Women's Rural Institute, church women's groups, fellowship and prayer groups meet regularly. The boating club organise whist drives during the winter. Sailing races for trophies are competed for at the annual Regatta. A football club and a children's playground is also found.
